subject: Web3
title: Sharding: Ethereum's Speed Plan
description: A short lesson to help you apply Sharding: Ethereum's Speed Plan.

hook.text: Ethereum processes about 15 transactions per second. Sharding aims to split the work across many parallel chains.

buildup.text: Sharding divides the network into segments. Each shard processes its own transactions simultaneously.

discovery.text: Instead of every node validating every transaction, each shard handles a subset. Throughput multiplies.

twist.text: Ethereum's roadmap shifted. Rollups worked so well that full sharding was deprioritized in favor of 'danksharding.'

climax.text: Danksharding focuses on making rollup data cheaper to store on Ethereum, rather than splitting execution.

punchline.text: The speed plan changed because a faster fix came along first.

quiz.question: What is the goal of sharding?
options: To split processing across parallel chains for more throughput
